p: When upper respiratory infections occur, rest and plentiful hydration are helpful. At this time, the first step is drinking enough fluids, some foods including bone broths and homemade vegetables like garlic are helpful too. Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. But there is not any strong evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has helped people protecting from the COVID-19 ( https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public/myth-busters). Some of the great herbal teas/hot drinks including ginger, peppermint, eucalyptus, chamomile, and hot water with honey, lemon and cinnamon are helpful for hydration and decreasing the symptoms of the infectious [ 29].
